results.title: Scandinavian Lands (Norway, Sweden, Denmark)
results.brief_description: An introduction to the geography, people, customs and standards of living of Norway, Sweden and Denmark. Explains that the Scandinavian peoples have utilized effectively the resources of the mountain, plain and sea in the development of agriculture, industry, trade and recreation.

results.title: Scandinavia: the rewards of excellence
results.brief_description: Describes similarities and differences in the geographic and cultural characteristics of Norway, Sweden and Denmark. Emphasises that skill, efficiency, and fine craftsmanship have enabled the Scandinavian people to make profitable use of meagre natural resources in developing an export trade and a high standard of living. Shows scenes of co-operative farming in Denmark, fishing off the coast of Norway, and manufacturing in Sweden.

results.title: Scandal = Shuban
results.brief_description: Made before Kurosawa’s breakthrough film “Rashomon”, “Scandal” is about a young painter, Ichiro, who finds himself embroiled in a scandal, when, whilst holidaying, he offers a motorbike ride to a famous singer. When two paparazzi witness this innocent outing they transform the incident into a torrid affair between the two. Outraged, Ichiro decides to sue, but the lawyer he employs - himself in a compromised situation - is easily bribed. A morality tale about the freedom of the press versus the rights of the individual, Kurosawa addresses the Americanisation of post-war Japan with his melodramatic screenplay, co-written with Ryuzo Kikushima. Beautiful black and white cinematography and impressive performances by Yoshiko Yamaguchi and Takashi Shimura.

results.title: Scales of justice trilogy
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Corporation and Michael Jenkins
results.brief_description: A trilogy of self-contained plays set in a world of law enforcement, vice, drugs, politics and organised crime. The stories are: THE JOB, about a young probationary constable torn between his moral obligations and loyalty; THE GAME, about two drug squad detectives who allow themselves to be compromised; THE NUMBERS, about a young politician whose actions conflict with the views of his parliamentary wing.

results.title: Scabies headlice
results.creator_credit: Leigh Tilson and Associates, Nina Syme and Leigh Tilson
results.brief_description: The great Australian itch! These two films should be seen by everyone because like it or not, they are both afflictions that can affect anyone, regardless of class or social importance. If left untreated they can drive you around the twist. The two films are “Headlice: They can catch anyone” and “Scabies - The Unwelcome itch mite”.

results.title: Scabies
results.brief_description: Exposition of modern British methods used in diagnosis and treatment of scabies. The film shows the habits and life-cycle of the mite, the secondary infections which make diagnosis and treatment difficult, and methods of treatment. Treatment at a centre is shown, and instruction for home treatment are illustrated. Examination of contact is also dealt with. Intended for doctors, health visitors, sanitary inspectors, nurses and medical orderlies.

results.title: Scabby mouth in sheep
results.brief_description: This film shows the troubles cased by this highly contagious disease in sheep, and explains methods of treatment and prevention by vaccination.
